casebody.data:
CAPE FEAR RIVER WATCH, et al
v.
NORTH CAROLINA ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT COMMISSION, et al. No. 373A14-1. Supreme Court of North Carolina. Oct. 10, 2014. Mary Louise Lucasse, Special Deputy Attorney General, for North Carolina Environmental Management Commission. Jennie Wilhelm Hauser, Special Deputy Attorney General. Charles D. Case, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC, et al. Matthew F. Hanchey, Attorney at Law. James P. Cooney, III, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC, et al. Austen D. Gerken, Jr., Attorney at Law, for Cape Fear River Watch, et al. Amelia Y. Burnette, Attorney at Law. J. Patrick Hunter, Attorney at Law. Frank S. Holleman, III, Attorney at Law, for Cape Fear River Watch, et al.

Opinion

The following Order was entered:

Pursuant to N.C.G.S. 7A-31(a) and (b)(2) and Rule 15(e)(2) of the North Carolina Rules of Appellate Procedure, the Court on its own initiative hereby certifies for review prior to determination in the Court of Appeals Cape Fear River Watch v. NC Environmental Management Commission, et al., COA14-708. The case shall be docketed in this Court as of the date of this order. Briefs of the respective parties that have been submitted to the Court of Appeals shall be considered by this Court. Any party may file a new brief in this Court consistent with the North Carolina Rules of Appellate Procedure.
